text: Draft - Grape and lemon rind funk with some sweetness, Clearish gold with a nice hits head. Touch of sour and sweet with some decent grain notes. Nice clean finish, solid.
Tap at À la Mort Subite. Aroma is candied sugar, caramel, fudge. Taste is sugary, caramel, metallic, just a touch of Lambic left. Medium carbonation. Useful to get a Faro tick, but not more I guess.

Glass at the Mort Subite in Brussels.
This is sweet all over it.
Poured copper, no head. Looked like a soft-drink. Smelled fruity, Sugar, cheese.
Taste is sweet, fruity.
Glass at Mort Subite bar in Brussels. Too sweet an not sour enough for my mouth.
Bronze, clear nice creamy foam. Musky aroma, sweet, fruit, sour, with refreshing aftertaste
From Tap: brown, ice tea-like clear color, no head, champagne and wild-yeast aroma, lightly sour, sweet finish, fruit, apple, light body, low carbonation
[9/18/15] Draught at Mort Subite in Brussels. Clear orange. Aroma of some funk, fruit, some sugar. Sweet flavor, mildly sourish, with mild funk, fruitiness, some sugar. Light-bodied. A decent Faro.

At Mort Subite, Brussels. Pours clear amber brown with a medium white head. Aroma of cheesy lambic, light funk, tart light fruits. Flavour is moderate sweet and sour. Light medium bodied with light moderate carbonation.
Keg at a la mort subite. Pours clear golden amber, nose is sugary, light horseblanket, taste is dry, funky, quite sugary sweet.
On tap at À la Mort Subite , Brussels.My first Faro. Kind of strange experience. Sweet and fruity with some sweetness and sourness, reminded me of a Rose Wine.

At the Mort Subite café in Brussels, where this brand is obviously cultivated to a high degree, seen the history behind it. Thin, snow white, quickly opening but still fairly stable head - the fact that this even has a head to begin with, reveals that it is not home made like faro should be in its authentic form. Deep, clear, pretty orange blonde colour. Aroma surprisingly still shows quite some lambic funkiness and complexity; hints of orange, artisanal cider, peach, sherry, dry white wine, wood, wet leather and hay. Soft acidic taste, citrus peel touch, mitigated by candi sugar sweetness as expected, caramelly too, sourish drought does continue though, paired with somewhat sticky, but not too disturbing sugariness. Not the most authentic faro, that much is clear, but it does retain a certain lambic character more so than most other industrial bottled faros.

On tap at Mort Subite, Brussels. Pours a clear coppery color, topped with a very small white head. Mild soury aroma, grapes and a hint of cellar aroma. Taste is sweet and fruity, with mild soury notes later on. Nice and enjoyable, easily drinkable.

On tap at Mort Subite, Brussels. This is great for hangover or when you are just tired. For those moods the sweetness is refreshing. Forget the energy drinks. The traditional cafe Mort Subite is also the right place to drink this. You get a time travel back to the beginning of the 1900s.

Tap at A La Morte Subite. Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is sweet malt, light berries and tart acidity, earthy notes. Flavor is sweet malt, sweet and tart berries, stale hops, earthy and barnyard yeast notes with a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

The best of this beer is its history. From drink for brewery workers to the top of beer styles. I can appreciate this brew. [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Subite Pub

On tap at Mort Subite in Brussel. Clear copper brown pour with white head. Aroma is tame, very mild funk, light oaky notes. Taste is sweet, malty with light sourness, just a bit of oak and cherry, almost like a flemish red but very light. Palate is med-light bodied with med carbonation. Not necessarily good, but better than a lot of Faro Ive had.
Tap @ Mort Subite, Brussels. Clear brownish pour with a generous head. Some very light funk, sugar, syrupy.

Draught @ Mort Subite, Brussels. Pours brown with a light brown head. Aroma is light sour, sugary, little tart fruit. Flavor is light sourness, white sugar, fruit, apples. Medium body, soft carbonation. 310714
Draught at A la Mort Subite in Bruxelles. Clear amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of sugar, sourness and fruity notes.
(backlog) Draft. Brown pour with tan head. Dark raw sugar, some other muted tones. Flavor is dominated by artificial sugars, caramel and acidic tones, almost syrupy.
Smooth and so sweet brown beer with poor head and nice aroma. Good for aperitives

Draught at A La Mort Subite. It pours clear amber with a small beige head. The nose is tangy, caramel, raisin, dried cherry, soft sugar and apple. The taste is sweet-sour, wood, apple, pear, ice tea, tangy and toasted sugars with a dry finish. Mediumish body and fine carbonation. Balance is pretty good actually, not as sweet as I expected. Solid faro.

On draught @ À la Mort Subite (Bruxelles). Light copper with a huge creamy off-white head and some lacing. Aroma is of brown sugar, light acidity and peachy notes. Taste is moderately sweet with brown sugar, some acidity and fruitiness. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Sugary finish. Not a bad Faro, but Faro isnt really a great style and this isnt one of the best... so thats an average beer at best.

Pours copper small white head 
Smells somewhat sweet 
Small carbo 
Bit cherry- aspects in the taste . Brown sugar 
Dry sourness in the back

Keg at A la Mort Subite, Brussels- 6th Nov 2013. Amber colour. Smells sweet and sticky with mild lambic in the background. Taste is sweet berries and mild funky sourness. Hit the spot at the time but there are better examples out there.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text: Fra fat på A la Mort Subite juli-13: rett rundt hjørnet fra hotellet, for en start på Belgiaoppholdet! Fruktig, lys og lett med en behagelig sødme. Perfekt i 28 varmegrader, og vi er klar for å utforske byens mange særpregede ølsteder.
Tap @ A La Mort Subite. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are sugar, malt, hops and just a little sour. Nice and refreshing.

Got this on tap at Mort Subite with sebletitje. It pours up with a clear deep copper body that supports a full lasting white head of foam that has slight pinkish hues. The aroma offers up mild yet inviting soured notes and yeastiness that quickly gets pushed aside by apple juice sweetness and ripe red apple wedges. The taste, boy they serve this cold, delivers first a modest tart bite that seems a little tannin apple skin like. It then runs into apple sweetness and drying vague mild tartness. Overall this seems uninspired as compared to other Faros Ive tried to date.

Draft @ A la Mort Subite.
Cuivrée col moyen blanc.
Arôme présente bouquet léger sucré le tout suivi par une sorte de pomme caramélisée et un très faible côté du lambic.
Palais est ici aussi une sorte dhybride entre un cidre et le lambic avec ce côté tannin pomme et jus de pomme trop présent. Le tout est sec, avec une fine note de sucre brun pour un palais restant moyennement aigre-doux. Franchement rien à voir avec un Faro venant de Cantillon ou Tilquin.
Cervesa daurada clara, amb acidesa ben equilibrada,regust equilibrat.Molt agradable

Pours an amber color with a white head. The flavor is mildly tart and lactic, but its also very sweet. Tons of candy sugar, a bit of grass, and some mild oak. Surprising amounts of lambic flavor to this, too. A bit of lemon and tartness, mild grass, some oak, and very mild funk. Still, it does have a lot of sugar and sweetness to it, as with any faro.
Draft at la Mort Subite. clear pale brown, minimal head. Sweet pale alcohol aroma. Light and tart. Very tasty and refreshing. Sugary light ale with some fun sour twists. Could drink this all day.
Tap @ La Mort Subite. Clear amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light barnyard and candy sugar. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Light dry and light acidic finish. 190712

On Draught at Mort Subite

Pours a golden color with a small but well retained head. 

The aroma is sweaty & grainy, particularly sweet smelling with some mild lemon character.

The flavor is sweet & malty at first but the tartness is there and the lemony sourness & yogurt flavors bring some needed balance. 

Its a nice drink, but after the hike to Mort Subite I was glad that they also had the Oude Gueuze.

26/V/2012 - on tap @ WoSF 2012 (Opstal) - BB: n/a (2012-545) 
Clear amber beer, no head. Aroma: some caramel, little sweet, raisins, dried fruit, little metallic, sugar bread. MF: low carbon, medium body. Taste: very sour start, then caramel, brown sugar, dried figs, sugary sweetness. Aftertaste: sour oranges, little bitter, bready, some spices.

A - honey brown. Slight clouds. Tiny layer of bubbles on the too.

S - Roses and honeysuckles. Sweet cream. Marshmallows

T - nice malt backbone. Sweet like candied fruits. Apple, strawberries and pears.

M - 60% carb. Heavy body and malty finish.

O  This beer taught me that I DO love faro style. Most excellent. 95/100

Like almost everyone else who has reviewed this beer, I had it at the Mort Subite in Brussels. Ive drank it there on previous occasions but never reviewed it before. This tasting was in Dec 2011.

Sat near the entrance and people watched as I sipped this sweet and sour blend of a beer.

The beer is a murky concoction of a red blonde/copper colour, the head biege.

The smells are sugary with some tartness thrown in for good measure. The aroma leads you towards thinking the fermentation isnt quiet over: the taste hints at this too.

More sweet than sour, but an interesting mixture of flavours, especially if you have a sweet tooth like myself.

Couldnt drink more than one in a session but it is a pleasant change from the heavy alcohol laden brews I usually drink when in Belgium.

On tap. A clear medium red colour  with an average high, off-white head. An aroma of malt, caramel and suger. The taste is medium sweet. A medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation and a medium long finish.

On tap at the brewery. Its a clear, copper-colored beer wtih a finger-thick, light beige head. Its rather sugary on the nose, with a touch of caramel and lemon juice. Dark sugars, some caramel, fruityness and a touch of acidity on the palate. Medium bodied and semi dry. Sugar, caramel, fruityness and acidity in the finish. Although a bit sweet, its a nice and refreshing beer. 110501
On tap at the brewery. Deep golden with an off-white head. aroma is sugar, dried fruit, caramel. Flavour is sweet, sugar, malt, caramel, candy sugar, dried fruits. Nice beer.

Sampled @Mort Subite, Kobbegem. A ring of bubbles, upon a clear, bright brown colored body. Low aroma level. Faint careamel and some grassy and earthy tones. Not very flavorfull. But  there is a weak, but clean malt sweetness.  Light-bodied, with a watered down mouthfeel. A decent thirst-quencer, nothing more.

Tap @ Mort Subite, Brussels.
Pours deep amber with practically no head. Aroma is mild, caramel, a bit of tartness, Belgian sugar sweetness. Highish carbonation, fine dry mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet and sugary, Blegian sugar, mild tartness. Fairly sticky. Well put together, but it still is quite sweet.

Big offwhite head. Clear amber body. Faint brown sugar aroma. Dry-sweet earthy grainy taste with strawy notes. Mild, soft mouthfeel. Mid-bodied. Dry watery grainy caramelly aftertaste with buttery notes. Not really much flavour to it. Not bad, though. (Taster at the brewery.)

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2012 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2011: amber with white foamy head, smell is rather unpleasant, very sweet with candy, sugar & wet dog, taste is very sweet with frangipane, marzipan, candy sugar, caramel & wood, very odd, like some kind of weird cake or something (3.3  previous score) // tried it again at WoSF 2012 // way better this time around // draft // amber with little ton o head // smells kind of like wet dog & candy sugar // sweet but great balance of sweetness, sweet candy sugar, syrup, tolarble fiting sweetness, sourness in the back is complimanting & not too much which is great because I never found the tart lambic to work all that much with the sugar // some tartness, lemons & acidity remaining int he back // fitting carb. (4.3  new rating) // will give it 4.1 instead, 0.2 points deduction for what I had in 2011
Draft at the source.  Clear amber color, no head or lacing.  Aroma of caramel.  Sweet with a subtle sour edge.  Not bad.
7th March 2010. Clear dark amber beer. No head. Light sourish nose. Crisp palate. Fresh sweet and sour Faro that finishes crisp. Decent - could drink a lot of this.
On draft at A la Mort Subite in  Brussels. Came a mahogany color with a white head. Nose is ripe fruit and wood.  Medium body and lively mouthfeel. The flavor is sour and complex. Sour finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Young lambic used probably as you smell the wheat quite well. Start is very nice, bit sweet though and this turns into sugar in the finish. What a pity because overall its a fine Faro.

From tap at Monks, Brussels. Golden color with white disappearing head. Both the appearance and aroma reminds me a lot of apple juice. Slightly slightly funky. Sweet and sour in both taste and aroma. Not too refreshing but still quite nice. Exceeded nmy expectations, which is always nice.

On tap at Mort Subite in Brussels spring 2010. Looks like a cognac or coke, white haze on top. The aroma is of cherry, wood, lambic. The taste first hits with its sourness and complexity, like a champagne. The finish is with wood and dried wood. Splendid!

Draft. Pours a translucent light chestnut color, topped with a small off white head. Quite sweet sugar aroma, with mild citrus and wood in the background. Flavor follows suit with sugar in the forefront, and wood, citrus, and nuts in the background. Sweet finish. Pretty decent thirst-quencher.
Clear brown coloured with almost no carbonation and a very small off-white head. Light malty sweet-sour hinted aroma. Full palate. Refreshing sweet-sour hinted finish.
Au fût à la Mort Subite. Très bon faro qui pour une fois le sucre ne dérange pas trop. Léquilibre y est y le lieu est mythique. Un des meilleurs des 6 Faro dégustés dans ma vie.

On tap at La Mort Subite, Bruxelles. Dark golden/amber coloured, small white head, not so pleasant caramel woody nose. Sweet malty, green apple and caramel with strong acidic finish. Heavy carbonation. I like faro style, but this one is more similar to overcarbonated cider than faro.

Surprised how much I liked this lambic, considering the sweetness it wasnt too cloying.  Amber color with a light, white head.  Peach-like arouma.  Peach also in the taste, sourness is strong and lingers.

(Draught)  Pours a dark amber body with a medium beige head.  Sweet aroma of candi sugar and green apples.  Flavor of subtle tartness (apple) and candi sugar with a mouthfeel somewhat similar to ginger ale.

Tap at Moeder Lambic. Amber with a creamy white head and lacings. Nose is sweet of malts, dust and caramel. Slight sour notes. Sweet almond and cellar notes in the background which is quite unpleasant especially the almond. Besides of that a good faro. Ends dry.

Draught a la Mort Subite. 
Amber/reddish with a bit of lace. Aroma: citrus, sourish. Flavor is sweet-and-sour, fruity, a bit cloying. Sweeter than usual, but nice enough balance. The finish is sweet, a bit syrupy, but not really too cloying. Much sweeter than a usual geuze or lambic, but refreshing and well balanced. A bit too syrupy, though.

From tap at La Mort subite. Pours clear and golden amber/brown with a small diminished off-white head. Acidic and roasted malty aroma. Mild sweet brown sugarish flavour. Mild acidic flavoured into a light sweet finish.

Draught. Clear golden brown with good off-white head. Very little aroma; slightly yeasty. Light body, well carbonated. Tart (green apples rather than citrus) lambic well balanced with some caramelly sweetness. Very little bitterness. Refreshing, pleasant, unusual.
Clear amber with tiny fast dissapering head. Light malty aroma with light notes of leather. Very sweet flavour with some sourness in finish.
Draught @ La Mort Subite. Clear amber with medium off white head. Sweet aroma with hints of wood and caramel. Sweet flavor with caramel and metalic notes.

Draught @ La Mort Subite, Brussels 1000, Belgium.Clear medium red amber color with a average, frothy, good lancing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, green apple, brown sugar. Flavor is moderate sweet and light acidic with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. (250508)

Comes to the table with a clear dark copper color and a small head. Aroma is surprisingly sour with citric lemon and tart berries. There is definitely a large lambic presence here.  And there is only a light sweetness which is presented behind the lambic and the sweetness works well in that place. Taste is mildly sour and lightly acidic lambic with dark tart berry sweetness.  Very easy drinking drinking and dries out at the end a bit. At this point this was the last faro I have drank it is definitely the best, better than Cantillon and its surprising from this brewery.  This truly had the least amount of sweetener.Tap @ La Mort Subite, Mort Subite short snifter/goblet on 5/18/08.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Draught at the brewpub. Clear amber colour with a small white head. Initial sour notes, with a sweet finish. Very refreshing faro.

[1133-20080228] Tap @ Mort Subite (Brussels, BE). Petrol sweet mild malt aroma with a bit of apple. Clear, deep amber orange body with a quick foamy white head. Sweetened candy alcohol flavour still has a bit of apple hiding in the background. Medium body is a little thin. Mild but has a nice sour tang.

Bottle. Bottle. Low but lasting off-white head. Aroma of damp orses and straw combined with old cheese, vinegar in the background. Vineous pleasant round flavor without beeing too sweet. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste.  Still a good deal of acitidy.
Draught at "La Mort Subite". Clear red/brown - white head. Sweetness, brown sugar, light synthetic, light sourness, tar. Dry finish. Æblemost. Boring.

Sampled on tap at la  Mort Subite. Pours a clear dark copper color with almost no head. The aroma has caramel and its sightly sour and funky. The flavor feel a bit more sharp than the flavor, caramel sweetness stays for a while in the mouth, theres also a mild lambic sourness. As expected, not bad but not exciting, been there, done that.

2008-02-28. Dark amber brown body with a modest white head.  Mild aroma sweet fruit struggles in an over filled glass, very very light hints at barnyard and straw. Sweetish flavour, light sour straw underlying fruity cider like tartness. (6+) Average palate. Meh, not unpleasant but underwhelming. On tap at La Mort Subite, Brussels

Draught at La Mort Subite, Brussels.
Clear orange coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of wood and white wine with light acidic notes.
Fruity flavour of wood and red wine with light acidic notes.
Tart finish.
On tap @ Mort Subite. Hazy amber coloured. Slightly sour with notes of spices and wood. Reminds me a little of a flemish sour ale - a bit too sweet.

A Mes rate: 
Draught at The Brewery during the Toer de Geuze. Typical translucent amber coloured Faro with very little head. Expected sweet aroma and flavour with more fruity character than usual and a delicate sour note. Pleasant but never outstanding. A little swift in the finish.

Draught at Mort Subite in Brussels

Pours a golden body and a fluffy cap of froth. The aroma is best described as a sweetened, less sour, with hints of honey and lemon zest, traditional Lambic. Exceptionally nice to drink; a beginners lambic, as some of the blue-cheese, funkiness of traditional Lambic shines through. The palate was spritzy and finished with a dry sweet-sourness. 
Really a was nice beer!

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2007 Draught @ A La Mort Subite, Brussels. Like many others here, this was my first faro. Dark amber with a thin off white head. Nose of cherry and balsamic vinegar. Sour but subtle sweet relish taste with fruity hints. Flat with an orange iced tea finish. Yum!

Draught at Mort Subite, Brusels.  My first faro.   Light brown color and low carbonation with almost no head.  Aroma is lightly sour.  Flavor is sweet champagne with a sour lambic finish.  Like nothing I have had before and very nice and refreshing.
Draught at La Mort Subite, Brussel. Orange brown coloured. Fruity aroma with acidic notes and some caramel. Sweet and sour fruit flavour with some refreshing acidity in the finish.

on tap at mort subite in downtown Brussels. Pours bright red, very clear, with a thin white head. Aroma is soft and sweet, hints of cherry and bubblegum. This was my first faro lambic, and I really enjoyed the mild sourness and sweeter start to it. Flavor starts with a sweet fruit, then fades to a tart and mild sour finish with a bit of wild character. Kinda earthy and dry but overall refreshing.

Draught at Mort Subite Café.  Clear amber body with only a little ring of bubbles.  Aroma of sugar candy.  Taste is sugary and fake, like some kind of red flavoured soft drink.  A tad sour and thats it.  I wish sudden death upon this mort subite.

On tap @ a la Mort Subite. 26/05/06. Cherry red body with brown tinges and a very short head. Sweet nose, Sour taste with sugar dumped in, medium body but seems heavy from the sugar. Funky aroma. Just a bit heavy (sugar) to drink lots of.

Draught at Mort Subite. My first faro. Beautiful, slightly dark copper. Lots of candied sugar in the aroma, alongside a hefty dose of lambic funkyness. Flavour and palate is tartness and sugar. Seems that the sweetness is in very good balance with the sourness of this beer. Quite complex. Positively surprised.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2007 Draft glass
Consumed at Mort Subite, Brussels, May 2006 Clear, thin, filmy toast colored head.  Dark golden burnt copper colored body.  Instately tart and acidic apples and cider hits the tongue, with some sweeter sugars showing up subsequently.  Fizzy, lightly sour, more cider-like than anything... maybe even soda-like in texture.  Finishes with very sweet apples and candy sugar, with a touch of caramel as well.  Good, refreshing, drinkable, but drinks like a cider or soda, not lambic. Even has some light apple vinegar aromas when it warms up slightly.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, 3 June) Well, a faro from Mort Subite? Doesnt come with high expectations, does it? Colour is dark, mahogany with ruby notes. Nose is fruity with cherries and wild berries, sweet but balanced, even with some chocolate notes. Taste is fruity with caramel and brown sugar. Surprisingly complex and well balanced. Actually a lot better than expected.
Draught. Quite acidic aroma. Dark prune colour, no head. The flavour is slightly sweet and a bit acidic with earthy undertones. Aftertaste is acidic and seems to have some aspartam.

Draught at La Mort Subite. Dark amber colour with a small off-white head. Sweet sourish aroma. Sweet flavor with lots of sugar, but there is some sourness in the background. Leaving you with a sour aftertaste.

Draft at La Mort Subite. Bronze bodied with a small off-white colored head. Nose is sweet-sour with light wood,  and vinegar notes along with faint tart fruits. Taste is sweet with a light fruit tartness, thinned vinegar, light lemon and some almost berry notes. Wet wood and faint earth notes come through in subtle tones. Body is very light with mild bubbles. Finishes with light balsamic notes, light tart fruits, and mild woodiness.

Draught at La Mort Subite, Brussels.Dark amber orange with a small off-white head. Sourish grapefruity and woody aroma with not much sweetness coming through. Like a mild geuze, not bad. Flavor is extremely sweet and sugary at first glance but then a nice sourish lambic chraracter shows up underneath the sweetness. Still to much sweetness, but with a nice middle and a good tart finish. Not excellent, not bad either.

Berrylike sweet nose.
Brownish, low on visible carbonation, low creamy head.
Brown sugar notes, grapes, apples, light roast.
A touch vinegary exit.
Medium to light body, sparkly mouthfeel.

Draught, Mort Subite, Brussels, May 05.

Head is initially small, frothy, off-white, mostly diminishing.
Body is light brown.

Aroma is moderately malty (toasted grain, caramel), lightly yeasty (barnyard), with a note of candy sugar, hint of sherry.

Flavor is heavily sweet, moderately acidic.
Finish is moderately sweet, moderately acidic.

Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation.

Pretty good for a faro, actually, though certainly no match for Drie Fonteinens.
Amber with a beige head. Toasted caramel aroma, with some mild citrus notes. Medium bodied. Flavour is sweet caramel balanced with tart citrus. Suprisingly refreshing.

served in a bottle with horizontal basket...how sweet it is.  this one had a nice fruit cherry nose....champagne effervesence and a light copper hue.  sweet on the palate ends with a smarty flavor of bitterness. easy to drink.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2005 Couleur ambrée, mousse blanche plutôt fugace.  Faible niveau de dégagement gazeux. Nez de sucre en poudre, de bois humide et de vanille, le tout  invoquant un jeune âge difficile à oublier.  Acidité moyennement présente en bouche.  Tartrique, lactique et légèrement boisé, un vague souvenir de lait en poudre maccompagne à chaque nouvelle gorgé.  Finale légèrement métallique.  Ma référence pour ce style étant limité, jai du mal à me convaincre que jen tire plaisir.  Probablement un style qui nécessite dêtre apprivoisé.  En fût au pub à la Mort Subite, voyage Europe 2005
UPDATED: NOV 4, 2006 Tap.  Sweet sugary aroma.  Medium brown color with little head.  Smooth sweet-tart flavor - no bitterness at all.  A nice Faro but definitely a sipping beer.
Draft at Mort subite cafe. Pours a deep auburn with a white head. Aroma is sweet-sour, with a litle funk. Taste is sweetnsour, with the candy sugar very present.
Amber colour with a white head. Sweet light acid fruity aroma and a dry taste. Medium body and a sweet dry foinish.
Draught at the Mort Subite Cafe. Served too cold, this was fairly dark with little head. Sugary with little tartness.. Not as unpleasent as some faros that ive tried.

Draught at La Mort Subite Cafe, Brussels. Orange, no head, treacly aroma. Very easy drinking beer, and although the first few sips reveal little complexity, gradually you get the sense of a well oiled machine at work (what does this mean??) Primarily sweet, brown/barley sugar, perhaps ginger, with a slightly soured finish, like a boiled sweet.
Amber with a small head. Aroma is fruity and sour. Flavor is really sour at first, there is citrus in it but also a sweet finish. Quite a dry palate.
An amber beer with a small head. The aroma is sour with notes of grapes and brown sugar and so is the flavor.

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. 
Copper colour. Sweat and sugar in the nose. Sourish tarty up front, followed up by a rich amount of sugar. Faro is not my type of beer - yet.
Amber/orange, nice small head. Aroma is slightly fruity, caramel notes and of course sourish. Flavor is also typically sourish, but also with citrus, grapefruit and some sweeter notes.

Bright amber colour.  Aroma as expected - horseblanket and sugar.  Palate is quite tart, with hints of caramel.  Brilliant balance as the sugar cuts through the lambic notes (as opposed to their regular Gueuze, which is vice versa).  Awesome faro, which the sarcastic might say stems from Keersmaekers extensive experience at adding sugar to lambic.

Draught @ Akkurat, Stockholm: Amber coloured. Clear. Not much head. Is sweet and light fruity in the aroma. Flavouris fruity and has some light sour notes. Reminds me a little of fruit syryp with water. Quite pleasant and refreshing. Body is a little thin, and the beer dies rather quickly on the palate. Good one, though.

Tap at the Mort Subite Cafe in Brussels. This is a beautiful red colored beer with huge with head. Aroma is mostly sweet with some very subtle touch of malt. Taste is very sweet with a nice touch of oak at the end. The taste is somewhat similar to the kriek. Carbonation is good and body is thin which makes it a very refreshing beer to sip during a hot summer day. Overall, probably one of the best Mort Subite product that I had the chance to taste.

(draught)  Clear, amber body.  Off-white creamy head, mostly diminishing and good lacing.  Barnyard and oak aromas.  Lightly sweet bu with a well-balanced sour initial flavour.  Lightly sweet, lightly acidic finish.  Lively mouthfeel.

(sampled draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden)Amber colour with a fine creamy white head. Sweet and sparkling fruity aroma. Flavour starts with candied fruit. Sparkling finish with a pleasant sour note. Refreshing!

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2005 Keg @ Akkurat, StockholmRed amber with brief creamy head. Pleasant fruity black cherry aroma and taste. Sweet, clean and rather soft with lightly acidic finish. Refreshing, and surprisingly complex. Less sweet than other (few) faros (faroes?). However a small glass is quite enough. A perfect welcome drink for your bbq!

(draught) Amber red, no head. Sweet nose, lots of Brett, but before all very fruity-estery. Nice refreshing taste, spritzy and sweet fuits, but NO excessive sweetness. Woody palate. Light bodied, very refreshing. Untraditional as it may be, I liked it all the same. Its a great summer beer, in its own right for those with a sweet tooth.

Sampled draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden.
Dark amber with brief creamy head. Pleasant fruity black cherry aroma. Sweet, clean and rather soft with lightly acidic finish.
Refreshing, and surprisingly complex. Oddly this faro has the most character of any of the Mort Subite beers I've sampled.

On tap at Mort Subite: Sugary sweet nose with hints of apples. Clean pale copper color and a low tight head. This is a spiciness in the middle of the taste profile, but no real bitterness or sourness for that matter. Full, round mouth feel. Unusual and complex taste, but overall kinda weak.
Fruity sourness. Orange body with hints of read, no head. Flat carbontion and somehow a wired mouthfeeling.
